body:
@gampleman Certainly. I'll see if I can capture the behavior I'm seeing in a test tomorrow. Giving your test a quick look, I don't see why we seem to be experiencing slightly different behavior. You explicitly set layout to false in your test case, and I conditionally do the same thing on non-html requests:

````ruby
layout ->(controller) { controller.request.format.html? ? 'some_layout_file' : false }
```

When I examine what the `_layout` call actually returns in your patched `ActionController::Caching::Actions::ActionCacheFilter#filter`, I get:

````ruby
Rails.logger.debug "#{controller.send(:_layout).class.name}"
# -> FalseClass
```

So being an instance of `FalseClass` and not `NilClass`, `!controller.send(:_layout).nil?` evaluates to `true` and the patch fails to prevent the controller from trying to wrap cache hits in a layout.

I'll re-examine tomorrow, not sure why your test passes by checking `nil` and my implementation requires checking `false`.
